resources.string: An unusual romanian restaurant with a modern/contemporary kitchen. Recipes as old as 100 years are reinterpreted and rearranged, lost flavours, invented flavours, all in one place.
Dedicated to the street food inspired from all over the world! The menu gathers the finest street foods in the world and the incredible variety of flavors that tell the whole story of a country.

Here the day starts with a good coffee, breakfast has no fixed schedule, lunch is tasty and evenings are relaxed. You can see how your favorite dishes are being cooked in the open kitchen, the garden is a refuge away from the city\'s hustle and you can easily lose the notion of time in the bar.

An authentic Italian cuisine, with a design that brings you closer to the beauty of Italy, a varied menu, designed for all tastes, with fresh ingredients, natural and carefully selected for a plus of flavor.

You could eat breakfast, lunch and dinner here and still want to come back for more after you\'ve been clubbing downstairs at Control and indeed you can: it stays open late at the weekend to serve pizza to the post-club crowd

On the banks of Herestrau Lake, this floating terrace is a brighter and lighter version of the already classic Bucharest venue. Opened only on summer days and nights, Biutiful “by the lake” brings together the best of two worlds, as the seaside feeling of the lake shore meets the hot, crowded city life.

Unique experiences? Yes please! Chefs Experience is a restaurant that offers more than savory dishes, one that promises that time spent is a real experience. Chefs offers you a generous a-la-carte menu with tasty international cuisine, designed to pamper even the most exquisite tastes.

In a classically elegant structure of metal and glass, the restaurant revives the greenhouses of the late 18th century, reinterpreted with a modern twist. Created by renowned chef Avi Steinitz, the international menu with French and Mediterranean influences is contoured with epic style and taste.
A mix of history, local culture and life style, a trendy entertainment district and favorite hangout for the locals
Also known as The People\'s House is regarded as former dictator\'s, Nicolae Ceaușescu, most cherished jewel. One of the most significant sightseeing objectives in Bucharest.
A wellness concept for modern lifestyle, dedicated to your well-being
The biggest classical music festival and classical international competition held in Romania and one of the biggest in Eastern Europe
Summer Well is an indie-centric music festival in Buftea, a town just outside the Romanian capital Bucharest.
A pedestrian event which stands for a city that provides joy to its inhabitants, one in which people partake of the streets at least as much as drivers do.

The largest park in Bucharest ideal for practicing all sorts of outdoor sports, for mere walks of for relaxation. The lake can be used for boat trips or water sport. The park is also a culturally sparkling opportunity, full of events inviting visitors to sample some of the specific character of the capital of Romania.

The Alexandru Ioan Cuza Park, or simply IOR Park is one of the largest parks in Bucharest, since it stretches on a surface of some 85 hectares. A considerable part of the park is filled by the Titan Lake together with its five islands.
The park stretches on a surface of 17 hectares, and, while being unanimously deemed the most beautifully landscaped garden in Bucharest, it also enjoys a central location in the city.
